item.text: King Ahasuerus then imposed forced labor on the land and on the coastlands of the sea.

Now <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04639" class="">actions</st> carried out under his <st data-num="08633" class="">authority</st> and his <st data-num="01369" class="">great achievements</st>, along with an <st data-num="06575" class="">exact statement</st> concerning the <st data-num="01420" class="">greatness</st> of <st data-num="04782" class="">Mordecai</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="01431" class="">promoted</st>, are <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03789" class="">written</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">Book</st> of the <st data-num="01697 03117">Chronicles</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">Kings</st> of <st data-num="04074" class="">Media</st> and <st data-num="06539" class="">Persia</st>?

Mordecai the Jew was second only to King Ahasuerus. He was the highest-ranking Jew, and he was admired by his numerous relatives. He worked enthusiastically for the good of his people and was an advocate for the welfare of all his descendants.
